newsitem.title: FRANCE: Current German barley availability 317,181 tonnes.
newsitem.headline: Current German barley availability 317,181 tonnes.

text.p: German intervention barley still available for export stands at 317,181 tonnes out of an original allocation of 500,000 tonnes, French officials who monitor European grain supplies said on Thursday.
Traders said earlier the European Union might boost the German barley allocation to allow room for a large sale to Saudi Arabia, which was said to have bought heavily on the world market.
Saudi Arabia bought 800,000 tonnes of barley at delivered prices of $160-162 per tonne, traders said, but there was no immediate official confirmation.
German traders bid on Thursday for 800,000 tonnes of German intervention barley but it was not clear whether this figure had been corrected for double-counting.
Other EU intervention supplies left available for export were 144,939 tonnes of German rye and 23,375 tonnes of German soft wheat as food aid, French officials said.
